description: Alterations to roof; first floor side to rear dormer extension; external alterations (demolition of side dormer)
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal">The
proposed submission, in the absence of accurately drawn plans which fail to coincide
with one another, lacks the necessary level of preciseness to enable officers to
make a formal assessment over the potential harm caused to adjoining residents
by virtue of overshadowing <span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">to
their first-floor bedroom window. The proposed plans, as submitted show discrepancy,
the proposed end elevation (DWG NO: 23001/COTMANGDNS-205) at first floor level
portrays a first-floor rear extension (roof felt) on side adjoining its
neighbour which does not coincide with the proposed first floor plans (DWG NO:
23001/COTMANGDNS-203) or proposed roof plan (DWG NO: 23001/COTMANGDNS-204). </span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">&nbsp;</span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">The proposal
fails to adhere to guidance contained under Para 44 of the ‘National Planning
Policy Framework’ (2023) and requirements under Part 3, Article 7 of The Town
and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015
(as amended)</span><span style="background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">.</span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

The proposed side dormer to first
floor rear extension, by reason of its mass, bulk and prominent siting, would
give rise to a visually obtrusive and incongruous form of development that
would be harmful to the character and appearance of the subject dwelling and
the local area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations set out in the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policy D3.D (11) of The London Plan
(2021), policy CS1.B on the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM1 of the
Development Management Local Plans Policies (2013) and adopted Supplementary
Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).

The proposed single storey side extension, by reason of its excessive
width, siting and site coverage and poor design would introduce an incongruous,
overly dominant, bulky and disproportionate form of development that would fail
to respect the scale, character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse and
that of the surrounding neighbouring properties, to the detriment of the
character and appearance of the host dwellinghouse and the prevailing pattern
of development in the locality and street scene, contrary to the high quality
design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policies
D3 (1), (11) and (12) of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the
Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management
Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document
Residential Design Guide (2010).

The proposed enlargements to the property by reason of their overall
scale and bulk, would form a dominant, inappropriate and incongruous form of
development, which would substantially harm the form and proportions of the
host dwelling, detracting from the visual amenity of the site and the
surrounding area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the
National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D(1) and D3.D(11) of The
London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012),
Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013), and
the adopted Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).
